description: Thoroughly trained in how to snort, trot, and stomp on the faces of its enemies.

name: Blue Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Russet Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Sable Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Coralscale Salamanther
description: As Raszageth's storms abated, this aquatic breed of salamanther was among the many wonders to settle among the shores in their wake.

name: Pond Nettle
description: This miraculous aquatic species can survive in the harshest environments, perhaps even the void of space.

name: Goblin Turbo-Trike
description: The turbo trike's tri-wheel design adds superior stability and a smaller turn radius over its two wheeled cousins.

name: Clutch of Ji-Kun
description: Although Ji-Kun feasted on the failed creations of mogu flesh-shapers, her progeny is willing to eat more pedestrian carcasses.

name: Dazar'alor Windreaver
description: Soaring high above the Battle of Dazar'alor, these beasts are drawn to the most cunning of victors.

name: Shadowmane Charger
description: Draenei poets have likened this talbuk's coloring to shadows cast by moonlight in an ashen forest.

name: Gilded Riding Crane
description: It is said that an emperor once paid a large sum for a golden crane. Upon discovering that the crane was only colored like that of the precious metal, he hid with shame in his bedchambers for a week.

name: Amber Primordial Direhorn
description: There is an old Zandalari saying about wild direhorns: "Run!"

name: Red Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Bone-White Primal Raptor
description: "They are lethal at eight months, very lethal." -Hemet Nesingwary Jr.

name: Ashhide Mushan Beast
description: Some people say that riding an ashhide mushan will result in favorable health and increased prosperity. These people are called "mount vendors."

name: Tyrannical Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These cloud serpents always look elegant and slim in classic black.

name: Mosshide Riverwallow
description: Aggressive and territorial, the mosshide is known for hiding in river-shore scrub and ambushing unwary passersby.

name: Green Primal Raptor
description: "Raptors are as loyal as they are vicious. If you ain't friend, you are food." -Kijara

name: Shadow Dusk Dreamsaber
description: A dreamsaber strikes quickly from the shadows, capturing small animals and slipping back into darkness without a sound. The lucky few who have seen a feeding dreamsaber can see them revel in lazily toying with their prey before beginning their meal.

name: Emerald Drake
description: "Is the emerald drake rare?  You have no idea.  If I had a silver for every time someone asked me about one, I could have retired years ago." -Mei Francis

name: Amani Battle Bear
description: The Amani trolls decorate these ferocious mounts in magic amulets and ceremonial masks as a way to venerate the bear god Nalorakk.

name: Jade Primordial Direhorn
description: The festive coloring belies deadly intent.

name: Swift Frostwolf
description: Amidst the cold heights of Frostfire, the frostwolves hunt anything they can catch. The fastest among them eat well.

name: Silver Riding Crane
description: This tall bird is one of the most graceful and elegant cranes, slightly moreso than the Bronze Crane but less than the Golden Crane.

name: Prideful Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that range from gold to pink. Or we could call it coral.

name: Subdued Seahorse
description: "One has not truly lived until they have felt the tidal current rushing through their hair while atop a majestic seahorse," said no one.  Ever.

name: Solar Spirehawk
description: Looking into the eyes of this mystical beast is like peering into the heart of the sun. Goggles are recommended when you're riding.

name: Rose Riding Crane
description: This brightly-colored bird is often confused with a flamingo or marabou.

name: Luxurious Riding Crane
description: A majestic bird, but a rather picky eater.

name: Trained Silverpelt
description: Prized for its intelligence, this breed of talbuk can be trained to execute defensive kicks and gorings in battle.

name: Grievous Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that are a mixture of ruby, gold, and nearly violet.

name: Warforged Nightmare
description: A nightmarish steed of hardened steel and vengeful spirits, this companion will follow you to the depths of the Firelands and back without complaint.

name: Red Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Vicious Gladiator's Twilight Drake
description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

name: Blue Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: Garn Steelmaw
description: A trainer once tried to put decorative metal in his steelmaw wolf's mouth. He had to wait three days to get it back.

name: Flametalon of Alysrazor
description: As with their matriarch, Alysrazor, the fury and fervor of these elemental avians are unquenchable.

name: Pale Thorngrazer
description: This talbuk subsists completely on a diet of thistles and thorns, making its insides as tough as its outside.

name: Swift Shorestrider
description: A rarity amongst the tallstrider breeds of Kalimdor, but easily recognized by its pungent dead seaweed aroma.

name: Smoky Direwolf
description: Believed to reside mostly in the north. Hates weddings.

name: Vicious War Ram
description: Until it head-butts you below the belt, it has not truly accepted you as its rider.

name: Emerald Hippogryph
description: These majestic animals come in various colorings, but the emerald variety can only be tamed by the magic of friendship.

name: Crimson Shardhide
description: When Korthia was pulled into The Maw, only a few hardy species survived.

name: Vicious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Dusklight Razorwing
description: Razorwings can be seen throughout Korthia, making their nests on high hills and in trees.

name: Archmage's Prismatic Disc
description: Three elements have been fused to create this magical disc, which is attuned to your specific magical powers.

name: Dread Raven
description: Filled with the hatred of an ancient god, the dread raven are the Arakkoa's most trusted guardians.

name: Gray Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Mystic Runesaber
description: Infused with arcane power, the Mystic Runesaber has long been hidden by chaotic nether energies. Recently they have emerged from the shadows in search of ley lines to sate their thirst for magic.

name: Dusty Rockhide
description: Ever since acquiring this mount, you have been plagued by strange fever dreams of hippety-hoppety clippety-cloppety elekk on parade.

name: Great Northern Elderhorn
description: One of the heartiest of species that inhabit the slopes of Highmountain, they can survive for months in freezing blizzards.

name: Mottled Meadowstomper
description: The elekk's long trunk allows it to sniff out sources of food, avoid danger, and steal snacks from your bags when you're not looking.

name: Slayer's Felbroken Shrieker
description: You broke it, you bought it.

name: Warsong Direfang
description: Has a will of iron but is a sweetheart if you give it a clefthoof bone to chew on.

name: Felsaber
description: A special creation of Lord Illidan gifted to his most trusted demon hunters.

name: Corrupted Fire Hawk
description: Millagazor was a fire hawk loyal to Ragnaros. At this time it is unknown how many of Millagazor's eggs were corrupted.

name: Winter Night Dreamsaber
description: These nocturnal dreamsabers carry the chill of winter with them and will often hibernate for days on end if not otherwise awoken.

name: Infinite Timereaver
description: Fickle and savage, these drakes slip in and out of time until they find a worthy rider.

name: Sunhide Gronnling
description: Loves the sun, hates everything else.

name: Vespoid Flutterer
description: A flutterer is an overgrown vespoid worker created to carry a rider. Rather than looking to a queen for leadership, it looks to its rider to guide it in all things.

name: Tundra Icehoof
description: A translucent layer of down hair covers this breed's leathery hide, acting as the perfect insulation for cold environments.

name: Ironhoof Destroyer
description: Blackhand is said to have personally designed the fiery armaments used on the Iron Horde's clefthoof battle mounts.

name: High Priest's Lightsworn Seeker
description: Once plentiful, only three seekers remain on Azeroth after generations of battling the corruption of the cosmos.

name: Snowy Riding Goat
description: The Kun-Lai Summit mountain goats are known for climbing even the highest peaks in search of kafa beans and salt licks.

name: Fur-endship Fox
description: These magical creatures thrive on love and friendship.

name: Purple Riding Nether Ray
description: Nether Rays are among the most trusted, versatile mounts in all of Outland and beyond.

name: Ashes of Al'ar
description: Al'ar was the beloved pet of Kael'thas Sunstrider, who often boasted that death would never claim it. Perhaps he was right.

name: Ban-Lu, Grandmaster's Companion
description: The child of Xuen, Ban-Lu has served each Grandmaster faithfully for many years.

name: Onyx Netherwing Drake
description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

name: Black Qiraji War Tank
description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

name: August Phoenix
description: The magnificent August Phoenixes are blessed by Chi-Ji to fill the hearts of riders with wonder and hope for the future.

name: Vicious Gilnean Warhorse
description: Born, bred and battle tested in Gilneas.

name: Gorestrider Gronnling
description: Once "befriended", a gronnling will happily carry its rider to their death.

name: Brown Riding Camel
description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

name: Garnet Razorwing
description: Korthia was once known for its bright red flowers. Several species were known for consuming or rolling in them, and taking on bright red coloration as a result.

name: Voracious Gorger
description: The devourers are presumed to have their origins in the In-Between, a space between the lands of the Shadowlands that few have explored.

name: Iron Skyreaver
description: Iron Horde beastmasters bred this rylak for war and then girded it for battle in black steel and smoldering flame.

name: Huntmaster's Loyal Wolfhawk
description: The spirit of the Great Hunter found you worthy, and now its children will answer your call forevermore.

name: Deathlord's Vilebrood Vanquisher
description: A powerful red dragon raised in undeath by its own life energies, a true mockery of life.

name: Core Hound
description: Molten to the core!

name: Morning Flourish Dreamsaber
description: Known for the lavish energy that emanates from them, these sabers are notorious tricksters. Their roar scatters the early birds that wake them.

name: Sundered Zerethsteed
description: Whatever the purpose of these cervids once was, it is long forgotten. Though they are not Dominated, they have been corrupted by the unintended presence of Mawsworn in the sacred realm of Zereth Mortis.

name: Trained Meadowstomper
description: The draenei perfected elekk husbandry long ago, adorning the creatures with Light-infused crystals to make them more docile.

name: Felsteel Annihilator
description: Forged deep within Hellfire Citadel by a mad blacksmith, the Felsteel Annihilator combines the metalworking knowledge of the Iron Horde with the chaotic fel energies of the Burning Legion into an unholy union of steel and flame.

name: Huntmaster's Fierce Wolfhawk
description: A jumble of talons and claws that can fly and swim. No one is safe.

name: Beryl Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Spectral Pterrorwing
description: Vengeful spectres abound in the spirit realm surrounding Dazar'alor.

name: Admiralty Stallion
description: These sleek white stallions are the few mounts allowed to embark on Kul Tiran ships.

name: Armored Frostboar
description: Subsists almost entirely on a diet of frozen berries. Though it finds slow off-worlders equally tasty.

name: Wild Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

name: Prestigious War Wolf
description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

name: Twilight Sky Prowler
description: Dubbed the midnight trickster by some, many a couple points to him as the reason their paths crossed in the night.

name: Jeweled Copper Scarab
description: The rulers of desert kingdoms would attune crystals to their personal mounts for quick summoning.

name: Bulbous Necroray
description: The necrorays of Maldraxxus prefer to congregate around the enormous decaying mushrooms of the region.

name: Brilliant Direbeak
description: The shimmering hides of these deceptively fierce and coordinated beasts are intended to confuse and disorient prey.

name: Prestigious Bronze Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Swift Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Vicious War Raptor
description: Because sharp teeth and claws weren't enough.

name: Giant Coldsnout
description: Its snout is not just cold but wet. Not a pleasant way to wake up.

name: Mollie
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: Shackled Ur'zul
description: Formed from the tormented bodies and souls of fallen members of the Army of the Light, the Ur'zul is both fascinating and horrifying.

name: Highlord's Vengeful Charger
description: What's he so mad about?

name: Sharkbait
description: Sharkbait's loyalty lies with whomever keeps the crackers coming.

name: Witherhide Cliffstomper
description: Tiny notches cover the hooves of this variation of clefthoof, allowing it to safely scale mountainous regions in search of food.

name: Starcursed Voidstrider
description: This shadow-infused strider embodies the elves' commitment to harness the power of the Void in the name of the Alliance.

name: Predatory Bloodgazer
description: The sheer amount of raw red berries these fierce omnivores consume gives them their distinctive eye color.

name: Infernal Direwolf
description: A mighty wolf of Draenor, touched by the fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan in Tanaan Jungle. It has not gone completely mad... yet.

name: Algarian Stormrider
description: Bred to fly true in the harshest conditions, this lighting-infused gryphon was trained in the thane's rookery to soar through the skies of Khaz Algar and into the depths below.

name: Flourishing Whimsydrake
description: These playful protectors of the Emerald Dream may be larger than their faerie dragon relatives, but they are no less mischievous.

name: Felblaze Infernal
description: The Illidari were able to break one of these fiery beasts for use as an unstoppable, fearless mount against the Legion.

name: Ratstallion
description: Years of chain-chugging potions in Dalaran's sewer system have allowed him to grow large, agile, and shadow resistant.

name: Underlight Corrupted Behemoth
description: The light from the saddle helps attract prey to this corrupted behemoth.

name: Vindictive Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Night Pterrorwing
description: Scholars interpret this creature's awful screeching as "fear me, I am the night!"

name: Island Thunderscale
description: One of the larger native dragon species on Azeroth, this subspecies subsists almost entirely on fish. And fishermen.

name: Bestowed Ohuna Spotter
description: A gift from the Ohn'ir, these ohuna are invaluable companions when scouting new horizons for the Dragonscale Expedition.

name: Adorned Vombata
description: Red-colored vombata are considered lucky by the Enlightened. It was a red vombata that was present when they first arrived in Zereth Mortis.

name: Prestigious Forest Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Lambent Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Rustbolt Resistor
description: "R E S I S T" is carved into the seat in crude letters, along with several, more profane things.

name: Arcadian War Turtle
description: Bred for destruction by an insane warlord in a far-off land, but at least the seat is warm.

name: Deathtusk Felboar
description: Veterans of the battle for Outland's Hellfire Peninsula are traumatized by thoughts of these beasts to this day.

name: Coalfist Gronnling
description: This little gronnling is well-known for smashing his way into garrison inns and making a mess of the pots and pans.

name: Jade Pterrordax
description: This favored mount of the Zandalari is a great singer, or so it thinks.

name: Prestigious Royal Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Snowfeather Hunter
description: Capable of hiding in a fog bank until prey approaches, then slicing them open with one claw-raised jump.

name: Vicious War Fox
description: Vicious as a fox.

name: Fearless Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Mechanized Lumber Extractor
description: Jepetto may have over done it a little...

name: Brinedeep Bottom-Feeder
description: These elusive fish prefer to skulk in the deepest reaches of the Great Sea, searching the darkness for food.

name: Vicious War Elekk
description: A favorite of warriors of the Exodar.

name: Clutch of Ha-Li
description: The brood of Ha-Li are comfortable in the blue skies of Pandaria, hunting unsuspecting prey.

name: Viridian Sharptalon
description: Adept at blending into dense, magical forests, such as one may find around the Broken Isles.

name: Fierce Razorwing
description: Razorwings generally stay away from other Korthian species, but with time and patience, they can be tamed as well.

name: Crusader's Direhorn
description: A loyal steed to the holy crusaders of Zandalar.

name: Vicious War Lion
description: Many squires were harmed in the making of this mount.

name: Black Battlestrider
description: A properly accelerated gnome in battle is a thing of terrible beauty. - High Tinker Mekkatorque

name: Frostplains Battleboar
description: If it didn't have the cool tusk ring, it would feel so silly in that outfit.

name: Teal Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Riddler's Mind-Worm
description: It feeds on your thoughts, even the ones you are thinking as you read this.

name: Ivory Hawkstrider
description:
"My winged children fill the skies. Not this one though."

-Aviana

name: Guardian Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Golden Cloud Serpent
description: Golden Cloud Serpents are a treasure to be enjoyed by all who visit the continent of Pandaria.

name: Pureheart Courser
description: These coursers have long been known to exist, but only befriend those that have gone to great lengths for friendship.

name: Heartseeker Mana Ray
description: Someone once told this mana ray it was adorable. It has been pursuing that positive feeling ever since.

name: Smoldering Ember Wyrm
description: Arcanagos sought to turn Medivh away from experiments into the arcane, but the influence of Sargeras had corrupted the wizard too deeply, and the great dragon paid for the transgression with eternal, burning agony.

name: Anu'relos, Flame's Guidance
description: Though her feathers flicker with flame's destructive potential, they do not scorch, but simply radiate a comfortable heat.

name: Swift Spectral Hippogryph
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Vile Fiend
description: Infused with acidic blood through a terrifying ritual, you can feel your control over this beast is tenuous at best.

name: Wild Goretusk
description: If you want a gentle ride, go find a "tame happytusk" or something.

name: Mechagon Peacekeeper
description: Keeps the peace by turning you into pieces.

name: Alabaster Hyena
description: These hyena are used by the Voldunai to quickly move unseen throughout the sands.

name: Glorious Felcrusher
description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

name: Scrapforged Mechaspider
description: You built this yourself, you should be proud, even though it's smoky, sparky, and loud.

name: Purple Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Cobalt Juggernaut
description: What started as a rideable mining and logging machine devolved quickly into chaos when engineers asked themselves if they could make it any cooler.

name: Pattie
description: Preservationist Kathos encountered Pattie on her first assignment to Vol'dun. Pattie developed an affinity to Preservationist work but is eager to delve deeper, helping adventurers in their sleuthing.

name: Taivan
description: You don't have to be what the world expects you to be. Be who Taivan knows you *can* be.

name: Great Greytusk
description: Sheds its tusks once a year. Is extremely shy until they grow back.

name: Mechacycle Model W
description: The rapid technological evolution of the descendants of Mimiron began with the introduction of a new gear, leading to such wonders as the tragically under-produced Model W.

name: Beastlord's Warwolf
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, it was raised in a crucible of molten fire and shows no fear.

name: Royal Seafeather
description: The sharp beaks of these parrots are capable of breaking open large nuts with ease.

name: Majestic Armored Vorquin
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Spirit of Eche'ro
description: The spirit of Huln Highmountain's pet moose.

name: Shadowblade's Lethal Omen
description: They'll never hear you coming.

name: Leaping Veinseeker
description: Bug spray and a hat with netting aren't going to do much in the swamps of Nazmir, bring a club.

name: Armored Vorquin Leystrider
description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

name: Highlord's Vigilant Charger
description: His blank horse stare is "vigilance," actually.

name: Domesticated Razorback
description: "Domesticated" does not mean "friendly." Bring some treats.

name: Netherlord's Accursed Wrathsteed
description: Shadow plus fire, what could go wrong?

name: Ironbound Wraithcharger
description: Its ethereal spirit is barely contained by its iron shell. The penultimate creation of Salanar the Horseman, these powerful steeds were once thought to have all been destroyed.

name: Ferocious Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Restoration Deathwalker
description: With the death of the Jailer and the ascension of a new Arbiter, the Shadowlands is returning to its great Purpose. Some deathwalkers recognize the role that mortal heroes have played, and are willing to serve as mounts.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE ALLIANCE!"

name: Vicious War Trike
description: The most devastating technology money can buy.

name: Darkmaul
description: An older shardhide, Darkmaul was relatively tame and friendly around Korthians. He was thought lost to the calamity.

name: Demonic Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Fierce Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Prestigious Azure Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Sentinel War Wolf
description: Captured in a Sentinel raid, the loyalty of the wolf favors the strongest.

name: Wastewarped Deathwalker
description: Raw swirling energy bound together into a cohesive form, it will only bend to the will of those strong enough to bind it.

name: Vicious Dreamtalon
description: This feline beast's preferred prey is the Alliance.

name: Umber Ruinstrider
description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

name: Riding Turtle
description: Slow and steady might not always win you the race but it'll get you there... eventually.

name: Shimmering Aurelid
description: Though it was once created to defend the Sepulcher of the First Ones, with its primary function now completed, it now obediently follows your command.

name: Flourishing Whimsydrake
description: These playful protectors of the Emerald Dream may be larger than their faerie dragon relatives, but they are no less mischievous.

name: Antoran Charhound
description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

name: Darkforge Ram
description: A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.

name: Nazjatar Blood Serpent
description: Monstrous serpents riddled with corruption serve as mounts for N'zoth's high-ranking lieutenants in the Great Sea.

name: Sintouched Deathwalker
description: Forged from the sins of countless diabolical dungeon denizens. Only those with the skills to overcome them may hold its reins.

name: Kua'fon
description: Once a little hatchling, raised into a mighty pterrordax by a loving handler. He never did learn to fly.

name: Surf Jelly
description: The time between being stung and being enveloped and devoured is short enough to consider not swimming in the Great Sea.

name: Wild Dreamrunner
description: Dreamrunners flit between this world and the Emerald Dream at will, reveling in their wild nature.

name: Gray Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: Bristling Hellboar
description: The one and only source for the rare culinary ingredient: cursed bacon.

name: Maddened Chaosrunner
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Arcanist's Manasaber
description:
Upon her return to The Nighthold, First Arcanist Thalyssra saw to it that adventurers who helped her liberate Suramar were rewarded with prized mounts from the royal stable.

Summoning this mount in Suramar City will also apply Masquerade.

name: Highmountain Elderhorn
description: The favored mount of Highmountain hunters, they can easily leap across the rushing rivers of Pinerock Basin even when saddled with a full-sized Tauren.

name: Mighty Caravan Brutosaur
description: Brutosaurs are used by the Zandalari Empire as both weapons of war and enormous, mobile trading posts.

name: Lucid Nightmare
description: When riding this mount, your thoughts often wander to far-off places.

name: Golden Discus
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to forms of currency.

name: Goldplate Bufonid
description: This armored bufonid is always ready to leap into battle... as long as that battle is really, really close. In a pinch, it can leap multiple times and eventually reach the battle.

name: Bleakhoof Ruinstrider
description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

name: Corrupted Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Dominant Gladiator's Storm Dragon
description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

name: Witherbark Direwing
description: Only a handful of these giant bats remain in the Arathi Highlands, carefully raised by the Witherbark forest trolls who first brought them here.

name: Nether-Gorged Greatwyrm
description: Few mana wyrms find sufficiently stable sources of arcane power to reach such a size. A greatwyrm's appetite for mana is unmatched.

name: Dark Iron Core Hound
description: You don't get dogs hotter than this.

name: Vicious War Clefthoof
description: The Mag'har bred clefthooves not only as sturdy pack animals, but also powerful instruments of war.

name: Honeyback Harvester
description: While most Harvesters dream only of honey and flowers, this adventurous specimen looks to the wide world beyond Stormsong Valley.

name: Valarjar Stormwing
description: The beating of its wings sound like the rolling of thunder in the distance.

name: Undercity Plaguebat
description: One of the last of the giant bats to escape Undercity following the siege of Lordaeron.

name: Dire Wolf
description: Once thought to be extinct except in the far north. Highly sought by those preparing for winter.

name: Notorious Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Dapple Gray
description: A favored mount of the sea priests who call Stormsong home.

name: Mawdapted Raptora
description: Since the Jailer's incursion, new raptora have been synthesized by Zereth Mortis that are capable of resisting the corrupting influence of the Maw.

name: White Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: Darkspore Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Draconic Gladiator's Drake
description: Its wings darken the skies with the shadow of conquest.

name: Vicious Warstrider
description: Exquisite, dignified and deadly.

name: Black Ram
description: I've not seen this breed in in ages, but when they're ram tough they stick around. -Veron Amberstill

name: Fiery Hearthsteed
description: These flying creatures thunder unseen across the heavens. How fortunate that this one has shown itself to you!

name: Brown Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Argent Hippogryph
description: Argent Hippogryphs will partner with only the bravest and most battle-tested champions.

name: Astral Emperor's Serpent
description: After the unburdened Emperor Shaohao gave his final breath to protect his people, a golden serpent descended from the heavens to alight the emperor's spirit to the peaks of Kun-Lai Summit.

name: Mecha-Mogul Mk2
description: The Mk2 is an updated design with a focus on comfort and reliability over firepower.

name: X-51 Nether-Rocket X-TREME
description: What it lacks in safety features it more than makes up for in speed and style.  Not for the faint of heart.

name: Snowstorm
description: He comes from the ice and snow, under the Azeroth sun where adventurers go.

name: White Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Infested Necroray
description: Necrorays lay their eggs in small clusters within the frills and hollows of decaying fungal blooms.

name: Kaldorei Nightsaber
description: The connection between a nightsaber and its hunter or huntress is nearly inseparable.

name: Chestnut Mare
description: Sturdy and steady; "the horse that built Stormwind."

name: Renewed Proto-Drake
description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

name: Netherlord's Brimstone Wrathsteed
description: The smell isn't particularly pleasant, and it REALLY stays with you.

name: Goldenmane
description: Lord Stormsong ordered his cronies to steal this horse from the Norwington Estate in Tiragarde, as he was covetous of its luscious golden mane.

name: Hand of Salaranga
description: Salaranga was the most cunning of her kin and hid amongst the Beastwarrens. She struck at the Banished One with a horde of bestial allies. It did not matter.

name: Swift Spectral Fathom Ray
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Desertwing Hunter
description: In service of the great Purpose, desertwing hunters were designed to fill distant skies of forgotten realms of the Shadowlands.

name: Swift Gray Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Explorer's Jungle Hopper
description: For when you're making a crash landing in the middle of an uncharted swamp because it's the only way to access that ancient temple.

name: Black Wolf
description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

name: Buzz
description: Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz! Buzz buzz buzz buzz buzz. Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.

name: Terrified Pack Mule
description: This poor mule was around Drustvar when the witches took over. He's seen too much.

name: Vicious White Warsaber
description: If you try to give it a belly scratch, you're asking for trouble.

name: Black Serpent of N'Zoth
description: The black serpents of N'Zoth are the harbingers of his ultimate vision becoming reality. Only those servants or enemies that can tread this space have any chance of wrangling them.

name: Kul Tiran Charger
description: The Kul Tiran military prides itself on mastery of both sea, through a vast navy, and land, with armed cavalry.

name: The Hivemind
description: A true union of minds.

name: Ivory Cloud Serpent
description: Ivory Cloud Serpents are often mistaken for roaring thunder as they tear through the skies with blistering speed.

name: Deepstar Aurelid
description: As one of the last remaining polyps of an elusive creature, this aurelid is at home in the water as much as the air.

name: Battlefield Swarmer
description: Corpseflies are strongly attracted to the smell of dead bodies and will swarm an active battlefield as soon as the first corpse falls.

name: Sandy Nightsaber
description: A rare color for a nightsaber, and rarely seen, they are prized amongst huntresses.

name: The Dreadwake
description: A ship unlike any other, held aloft by a gift from an unknown kraken-faced god of the deeps.

name: Warstitched Darkhound
description: These warhounds are crafted by the House of Constructs to carry any rider into the thick of battle, rending and tearing enemy mounts all the while.

name: Enchanted Wakener's Runestag
description: Wakener runestags fiercely protect their wildseed groves. When the groves starting to fail, many runestags went berserk.

name: Bound Shadehound
description: Created by deciphering and performing powerful runic magic, this Shadehound is bound to its creator.

name: Underlight Shorestalker
description: Aid your deep sea charger in its hunt for prey along the ocean floors.

name: Duskflutter Ardenmoth
description: These ardenmoths prefer the dark and damp forests of northwest Ardenweald, where fungal colonies are perpetually blooming.

name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

name: Harvester's Dredwing
description: The dredwings of the Harvesters fear no mawsworn, and will gleefully sink their teeth into anything that threatens Sinfall.

name: Rajani Warserpent
description: Fierce companions of the followers of Ra-den, the Rajani Warserpents are a force to be reckoned with.

name: Silver Tidestallion
description: This tidestallion and its silvery scales were drawn to the glint of plunder in your pocket.

name: Umber Nightsaber
description: Nightsabers are an integral part of the Kaldorei's army, serving as both mount and assault weapon in one.

name: Ashenvale Chimaera
description: Ashenvale chimaeras were used frequently by the Kaldorei to decimate structures in battles against the humans, orcs, and undead.

name: Gargantuan Grrloc
description: It's the biggest murloc you've ever seen!

name: Daystorm Windsteed
description: It is said that when lightning strikes the sun, a gleaming beast in red armor would emerge from the heavens. The Daystorm Windsteed has never heard of these legends and has been here the entire time.

name: Rubyshell Krolusk
description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

name: Bloodhoof Bull
description: Members of the Warsong clan have long hunted these clefthoof to use their crimson-hued skin for battle standards.

name: Trained Snarler
description: Enormously cute as a puppy. Slightly less so now.

name: Grove Defiler
description: The Grove Wardens of the Emerald Dream were some of the first to fall to the corrupting influence of the Nightmare.

name: Ancestral Clefthoof
description: This clefthoof has seen ages pass, witnessing everything and patiently teaching many to ride.

name: Flarecore Infernal
description: The Legion has conquered thousands of other planets, devising fiendish alterations to their war machines when faced with extreme conditions.

name: Azure Worldchiller
description: In the corners of Azeroth, stories are told of a dreaded dragon who swept a pall of torment over the land. In some versions of this story, his fiery presence brought cataclysmic death and destruction worldwide. In other versions, he is blue.

name: Crypt Gargon
description: Loyal hounds of the Curator, these gargon patrol the crypts and catacombs deterring both trespassing and escape.

name: Rusty Mechanocrawler
description: The check engine light is always on, it's when it goes off that you should be worried.

name: Merciless Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Winterborn Runestag
description: Winterborn runestags are blessed by the Winter Queen herself. Their runes flare brilliantly when predators are nearby, warning the entire herd.

name: Majestic Azure Peafowl
description: The peafowl is renowned for its stunning colors and plumage.

name: Pale Acidmaw
description: The acid present in the ichor of this creature sapped away the color from its shell, leaving it a striking shade of snowy white.

name: Green Wind Rider
description: After being freed from vicious harpies by Cairne and Thrall, many of these creatures became valuable companions of the Horde.

name: Pale Regal Cervid
description: Looking at these majestic creatures, it's not difficult to see how the idea of cervids developed into the stags found on Azeroth and other mortal worlds.

name: Teldrassil Hippogryph
description: One of the last of the great armored hippogryphs to escape the burning of Teldrassil, it carried the last few citizens it could to safety before collapsing of exhaustion.

name: Spinemaw Gladechewer
description: Spriggan riders tie bits of anima-less detritus to the end of sticks in front of their gorm mounts to steer. It's... an imperfect art.

name: Red Flying Cloud
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the discovery and sharing of Pandaren lore.

name: Drake of the Four Winds
description: Rocks erode, fires sputter, but wind remains powerful regardless of the passage of time. -Phaoris

name: Zandalari Direhorn
description: The Zandalari pride themselves on being the first to raise and train all of the most ferocious lizards on Azeroth.

name: Chosen Tauralus
description: Even an unarmored tauralus is a valuable ally in battle, its enormous horns capable of piercing even plate armor.

name: Brown Ram
description: Male rams will often smash their thick skulls against each other for hours to impress a female. In that way, they're very similar to dwarves.

name: Mawsworn Charger
description: The fate of all horse mounts.

name: Hand of Hrestimorak
description: The treachery of Hrestimorak was infamous, betraying his people to claim power. Facing damnation in the Maw, he tried to subvert the Jailer... a foolish act that would earn him an eternity of torment.

name: Wicked Swarmer
description: When the Void reached out, the Aqir were formed in its terrible image.

name: Swift White Hawkstrider
description: I may question Prince Kael'thas's loyalties, but never his style. -Elrodan

name: Fabious
description: He emerges from the water, fins swaying lazily in the breeze, sun-kissed scales glittering. He is... Fabious.

name: Lunar Dreamstag
description: The moon's pale light is reflected in the pelt of these elusive nocturnal creatures.

name: Ny'alotha Allseer
description: To find him, drown yourself in the Circle of Stars.

name: Voyaging Wilderling
description: These playful visitors from another realm thrive while traveling to new lands with new friends.

name: Shadowbarb Drone
description: Void, jelly, and a very full belly is all this drone needs.

name: Vicious Black Bonesteed
description: These skeletal steeds know no fear, eat no grains, and can travel impossible distances.

name: Shadeleaf Runestag
description: The shadeleaf runestag are bred for their ferocity as well as their beauty by the Wild Hunt. They feel no fear charging into the den of any predator.

name: Maldraxxian Corpsefly
description: Corpseflies were once found throughout Maldraxxus, but many died out in the absence of anima. With anima flowing once again, they swarm.

name: Black Skeletal Horse
description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

name: G.M.O.D.
description: Garishly sporting extreme amounts of goblin flair, Gallywix commissioned his Mech of Death to one up Mekkatorque in combat and more importantly in style.

name: Voldunai Dunescraper
description: These brightly-colored fliers are rarely captured in the wild due to their naturally untrusting natures.

name: Grimhowl
description: Otherwise known as The Flame Woof, the Fetcher of the Igneous, Molten Core's Best Friend, Forgehound Maximus, the Best Fiery Boy, and "oh no is that an AXE on his face!?"

name: Winterspring Frostsaber
description: Taming this savage breed requires patience, strength, and a large supply of fake mice and twine.

name: Deadly Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: These reanimated vessels of destruction do not fear death; they dispense it.

name: Enchanted Winterborn Runestag
description: Winterborn runestags are the favored mount of the Winter Queen herself, and she only bestows such a creature on her most favored subjects.

name: Bonehoof Tauralus
description: There are quite a few reasons that you do not want to stand behind a tauralus, the hooves and whip-like tails being the least of them.

name: Swift Moonsaber
description: Many night elves revere these proud mounts because their shimmering coats symbolize the goddess of the moon, Elune.

name: Great White Kodo
description: A rare albino of the species first spotted in Desolace.  The centaur claim that a white kodo is a harbinger of doom.

name: Black War Elekk
description: Uniquely aggressive and pugnacious elekk bulls are culled from the herd and sold to Ethereal traders. The traders then train the bulls for combat and sell them to owners unconcerned about safety.

name: Great Red Elekk
description: Never seen in Nagrand, the first red elekk calves were born in Azeroth after the Exodar's arrival. Some breeders theorize that the unique coloration is somehow caused by the same radiation which ravaged Bloodmyst Isle.

name: Compass Rose
description: Pried from a giant Hearthstone game box.

name: Swift White Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Warhorse
description: Trained to stand firm in righteous combat.

name: Blackpaw
description: Blackpaw was just hibernating, minding his own business, and then suddenly there was a warfront.

name: Vicious Moonbeast
description: Unlike most of its kind, this moonbeast has a taste for Horde blood and an affinity for the color blue.

name: Acherus Deathcharger
description: Some horses merely adopt the dark. This horse was born in it, molded by it.

name: Bloodflank Charger
description: Stolen from the Arathi Basin stables, this fire-hearted charger now steeds for the Horde.

name: Red Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Deathrunner
description: These wild cervids are only truly at peace when running through--or between--the lands of Death.

name: Striped Nightsaber
description: Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.

name: Swift White Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Prestigious Bloodforged Courser
description: Forged in a fiery hatred, the offspring of a nightmare and a dream, this steed feeds on grains grown with the tears of your enemies.

name: Hopecrusher Gargon
description: Once the loyal mount of a House Briarbane lord, it turned on the lord and his retinue. Members of House Briarbane now whisper of a dark Gargon lying in wait even baiting venthyr who venture through the darker parts of the Chalice District of Revendreth.

name: White Stallion
description: The powerful and unyielding white stallion features heavily in the myths of ancient human tribes.

name: Swift Brown Ram
description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

name: Kor'kron Warsaber
description: Finding a litter of nightsaber kittens, a squad of Kor'kron Outriders trained them into a formidable pack of deadly mounts.

name: Azshari Bloatray
description: The naga raised these rays in captivity, harvesting their gas organs to craft alchemy which allowed them to breathe air more easily.

name: Brown Riding Goat
description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

name: Forsworn Aquilon
description: Originally produced by the Forsworn with stolen blueprints, these powerful centurion are now earning a reputation across the Shadowlands.

name: Darkened Vombata
description: The schematic to synthesize these darkened vombata seem to have appeared as a reaction to the Mawsworn invasion. The resulting vombata look different--darker, much like the invaders--but behave normally.

name: Headless Horseman's Mount
description: Be it into the flood, or into the fire, this one will go where you require.

name: Swift Red Hawkstrider
description: What do you mean is it dyed? Oh, the bird. We did touch up the red just a little. -Trellis Morningsun

name: Ascendant's Aquilon
description: The aquilon can rapidly transport aspirants, stewards, and even ascended to a location. Hey, sometimes your wings get tired.

name: Ironclad Frostclaw
description: Captured in the snows of Alterac Valley, this bloodthirsty hunter now roars for the Alliance.

name: Elysian Aquilon
description: With anima once again flowing to the Eternal Forge in Bastion, the plans for the aquilon centurion could be crafted once more.

name: Aerial Unit R-21/X
description: King Mechagon's private aerial unit, complete with deployable blast cannon and foot warmers.

name: Ivory Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Ancient Frostsaber
description: The lack of spots or stripes marks this beast as a descendant of the most ancient frostsaber line.

name: Steamscale Incinerator
description: A mad gnomish inventor had a dream to ride a dragon, so he created this metal monstrosity. He powered it with a trapped demon, in order to create "an authentic dragon soul," and did not survive its activation.

name: Biletooth Gnasher
description: Its bite is definitely worse than its bark-like gurgling sound.

name: Unshackled Waveray
description: The Unshackled have a natural kinship with the species of the deep seas that have seen cruelty at the hands of the naga.

name: Imagiwing
description: There's nothing more beautiful than watching your imagination take flight.

name: Curious Crystalsniffer
description: Most vombata enjoy tunneling through the ground, but these sniffers seem to have an unerring ability to locate crystals buried deep underground and will congregate around large deposits.

name: Silverwind Larion
description: This gift of the silvery winds is only bestowed upon those that search high and low for the wisdom of Bastion.

name: Sinrunner Blanchy
description: In life, Blanchy appeared to be an affectionate, well-behaved horse of excellent disposition and appetite. What evils must she have committed in secret to have earned her place among the condemned souls of Revendreth?

name: Obsidian Worldbreaker
description: "I have had many names throughout history, all of them spoken with dread: Neltharion, Xaxas, and many more. Yet you shall know me best as Deathwing, for so I am! I am the bane of life, the darkness within history, the lord of death, the master of destruction. And I tell you now, and so it is true, that this world is mine!" - Neltharion, the Earth-Warder

name: Ankoan Waveray
description: The Ankoan have been battling the naga for years, and with a natural affinity for the sea, training the local wildlife was a natural strategy.

name: Mawsworn Soulhunter
description: Soulhunters are used to track wayward souls across the wastes that flee from their dark fates, and are one of the only creatures that feel comfortable traversing the maw.

name: Swift Zhevra
description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

name: Tamed Mauler
description: When it comes to taming devourers, all it takes is a little anima and a lot of patience. And a lot of healing potions.

name: Captured Swampstalker
description: A swamp-dwelling subspecies of pterrordax known to feast on young bloodfeasters.

name: Ensorcelled Everwyrm
description: Anima is a fundamental force that infuses the Shadowlands. It flows through many creatures, but is also traded, bartered for, and fought over.

name: Tazavesh Gearglider
description: Brokers of all types use these gliders to travel around Tazavesh and similar nearby outposts, and carry their goods as well.

name: Predatory Plagueroc
description: Gieger's everlasting hunger is legendary amongst the House of Constructs, and no beast is too large or bony to fit inside its massive stomach.

name: Sundancer
description: This sun-dappled courser gallops on lightbeams with carefree abandon.

name: Brewfest Riding Kodo
description: You can't remember exactly how you got this mount. Then again, you can't remember much of anything that happens at Brewfest.

name: Swift Stormsaber
description: Rumor has it that this breed was named after the renowned archdruid Malfurion Stormrage.

name: Amber Ardenmoth
description: The brilliant orange hue of the amber ardenmoth signals to predators that it is dangerous to eat. Consuming one of these creatures will put a predator into a dreamless sleep for years.

name: Silvertip Dredwing
description: Bred by the Revendreth prince, Renathal, these rare dredwing are fiercely loyal and will only let those deemed worthy by the prince himself to interact with them.

name: Mimiron's Jumpjets
description: Created as a prototype by Mimiron. The pieces were stolen from his workshop, sold, and lost to time. That is until now..

name: Fallen Charger
description: The charger's screams echo across the Maw as it continues a never-ending ride across the land, forever looking for escape from the endless torments it has been forced to endure.

name: Sinfall Gravewing
description: With anima once again flowing in Sinfall, the Stonewright has been able to infuse these Stoneborn, making them valuable allies in the battles to come.

name: Swift Orange Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Val'sharah Hippogryph
description: These majestic hippogryphs are as close to a being of the Emerald Dream as any resident of Azeroth can be, and do not bond with a rider easily.

name: Bruce
description: BRUCE!

name: Inquisition Gargon
description: The gargon of the Inquisitors are some of the most vicious ever carved. The Avowed seek to recapture these beasts and return them to the righteous duty of assisting in the purifying of souls rather than the perversions performed at the hands of the Inquisitors.

name: Corridor Creeper
description: The loyal hounds of the Jailer creep along the corridors in search of the scent of souls.

name: Venomhide Ravasaur
description: You raised this thing from a scaly pup - Mor'vek would be so proud. But he'd still make you clean up the mess it made in the corner.

name: Wild Glimmerfur Prowler
description: This prowler's brilliant green coat distinguishes it from the blues and purples of Ardenweald, making it much easier for others of its kind to see through the midnight woods.

name: Enchanted Dreamlight Runestag
description: The majestic runestags are capable of siphoning anima from the ambient light of Ardenweald with their elaborate antlers. The anima is used as nourishment and to power the runestag's speed and magic.

name: Blue Marsh Hopper
description: That squishing sound every time it takes a step? That's a feature.

name: Armored Razorback
description: Never... ever... EVER... let it smell bacon on you.

name: Deepcoral Snapdragon
description: The snapdragon is a quiet hunter in the water, but is far less stealthy on land.

name: X-995 Mechanocat
description: The X-995 is the ultimate in customizeable feline robo-companionship.

name: Caravan Hyena
description: The canopy atop this dune-wanderer can be stored at your campsite, should you desire to feel the wind in your fur.

name: Beastlord's Irontusk
description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, its tusks can pierce even the hardest Iron Horde steel.

name: Polly Roger
description: The scourge of the slightly-northeastern seas, giant parrots like Polly can live for up to 2000 years. What a wonderful curse on your next of kin.

name: Dread Gladiator's Proto-Drake
description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

name: Uncorrupted Voidwing
description: This spawn of Vexiona, cleansed by Wrathion, comes from a flight with a fractured past and uncertain future.

name: Tomb Stalker
description: These fierce beasts are entombed alongside kings so they may carry their masters through the afterlife.

name: Blossoming Dreamstag
description: The pelts of young dreamstags flower with the vibrant colors of the dream.

name: Rusted Proto-Drake
description: Not as shiny as the other one, but it's still a great find lads. Brann Bronzebeard

name: X-51 Nether-Rocket
description: First designed as a booster for a much larger rocket, the X-51 was determined to give the perfect thrust capacity for a single rider payload.

name: Swift Spectral Armored Gryphon
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Grotto Netherwing Drake
description: After traveling to Outland and back, it's only natural these drakes seek out new skies.

name: Liberated Slyvern
description: It's difficult to tell because it's far too angry, but this slyvern is actually glad it's not owned by gnolls anymore.

name: Vulpine Familiar
description: A fiercely intelligent and curious species, these fox-like creatures have travelled the Great Dark Beyond and found their way to Azeroth. Drawn to Azeroth's champions, they seek adventure and companionship.

name: Swift Zhevra
description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

name: Russet Bufonid
description: Russet is a rare color among bufonids that is normally only seen on specimens that are tainted by other cosmic forces, or synthesized from a perplexing schematic that invokes that color.

name: Red Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Mail Muncher
description: Worming its way through the Postmaster's network, this serpent of N'Zoth deprived Azeroth of its primary magical correspondence.

name: Anointed Protostag
description: Only those most esteemed by the Enlightened are trusted with the reins of this rare cervid.

name: Red Wolf
description: Almost none remain in the whole of Azeroth; only the most experienced will have seen one.

name: Gilded Prowler
description: The mighty larion is an apex predator of Bastion, but that does not stop it from enjoying a nice nap in the sunny fields.

name: Sylverian Dreamer
description: An artist in the magical city of Dalaran fell asleep on her brush, and dreamed of painting a beautiful feathered dragon. Her artwork leapt from the page, and when she awoke, she found it sleeping gently beside her.

name: Golden Regal Scarab
description: Plated with gold and socketed with emeralds, this scarab is fit to fly royalty in style.

name: Hogrus, Swine of Good Fortune
description: Hogrus was first seen by Emperor Shaohao on the third day of his meditation, and is considered by the Pandaren to be a sign of good fortune to come to those who take action.

name: Violet Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Verdant Skitterfly
description: Verdant skitterflies are the perfect mount for the scouts of the Dragonscale Expedition scouts, as they are fast and blend into the foliage of the Dragon Isles.

name: Horrid Dredwing
description: Harika the Horrid terrorized the denizens of the Forest Ward, and with her demise her broodlings can now take this horror to denizens farther afield.

name: Sea Turtle
description: Often caught by fishermen at a young age, these mounts are much more comfortable in the water than they are on land.

name: Ivory Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Arctic Wolf
description: Once thought to be nearly extinct, this wolf can still occasionally be seen in the company of a few Horde veterans

name: Vicious Black Warsaber
description: The only thing these big cats bring home as gifts are the severed limbs of your enemies.

name: Bronzewing Vespoid
description: Bronzewing vespoids are the result of attempting to synthesize a vespoid queen with no other members of a new hive. While no mortal has yet discovered how to synthesize a hive, the bronzewings are reliable mounts just as they are.

name: Snapdragon Kelpstalker
description: When a snapdragon bites you, the worry isn't about the bite itself, but the poison that will begin to eat away at the wound.

name: Beryl Shardhide
description: These shardhides find it easy to hide in the underbrush, and it is rare to find one that is tamed.

name: Wonderwing 2.0
description: Don't ask what happened to the first one -- Mechagon technology is still gnome technology!

name: Ineffable Skitterer
description: These tarachnids move with a purpose unknown to others, answering only to a higher calling. Whatever that may be, it appears to include routine assistance to mortals who need a ride. For now.

name: Genesis Crawler
description: The Enlightened who have observed tarachnids believe that this variety may be some of the first beings to ever walk the land of Zereth Mortis.

name: Hand of Nilganihmaht
description: Of all the giants who dared defy the Jailer, Nilganihmaht was the most arrogant. For this transgression, the giant's severed hand was hidden within a veil of torments, and the rings that could summon it back were scattered across the Maw.

name: Highland Mustang
description: A valiant steed on the Arathi Highlands, it knows no fear.

name: Blue Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Noble Bruffalon
description: It is a great honor to be trusted with one of the Maruuk's loyal hunting companions. This Bruffalon is reliable and steadfast through any hardship.

name: Twilight Avenger
description: Little is known about the fate of the twilight dragonflight, though they seem to exist in numbers in Grim Batol to this day.

name: Thundering Jade Cloud Serpent
description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

name: Palomino
description: Human nobles have long favored this majestic breed for its beautiful golden coat and flowing white mane.

name: Rampart Screecher
description: Roosting among the ramparts of Castle Nathria, these giant dredbats act as sentinels and are trained to take down threats approaching the castle from the air.

name: Swift Olive Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

name: Vicious War Croaker
description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE HORDE!"

name: Purple Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Craghorn Chasm-Leaper
description: These mighty leapers have adapted to island life by learning to catch seagulls swooping through crags and fissures.

name: Unsuccessful Prototype Fleetpod
description: This creature was not designed by the First Ones, but instead by an unknown being attempting to create a very fast runner. Needless to say the attempt failed, because this mount is very slow.

name: Skeletal Horse
description: Like most undead creatures, it did not choose its fate.

name: Pale Gravewing
description: Gravewings know no fear and are nearly indestructible -- perfect for an assault on the Maw.

name: Silky Shimmermoth
description: The moths of Ardenweald play a vital role in the ecosystem, carrying spores, anima, and pollen from one part of the forest to the other, providing nourishment and variation to the denizens living below.

name: Soaring Skyterror
description: The extra-light equipment on this chromatic rylak allows it to swoop and glide through the clouds easily, free from the bounds of the land below.

name: Swift Gray Steed
description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

name: Sinful Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This mount shows a proclivity for snacking upon the souls cast out of Revendreth.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Loyalty
description: A marvel of steward engineering, the armored phalynx is a rare and awe-inspiring sight.

name: Emerald Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Chittering Animite
description: These exceptionally agile fliers make excellent mounts once they've been trained not to sap every ounce of anima from their rider.

name: Swift Blue Raptor
description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become steed, guardian, and friend.

name: Vengeful Nether Drake
description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

name: Swift Razzashi Raptor
description: The only known Razzashi Raptors were said to have been in the custody of Bloodlord Mandokir in Zul'Gurub.  This species of raptor has not been seen in many years.

name: Furious Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
description: Some of Azeroth's mightiest dragons have been summoned across the veil between life and death to serve new masters with undying loyalty.

name: Alabaster Thunderwing
description: Chiseled by the stoneworkers of Orgrimmar, this stone wind rider is a symbol of the unwavering strength of the Horde.

name: Vibrant Flutterwing
description: These minty green moths are very friendly. They particularly enjoy having their head fuzz vigorously brushed. They also enjoy music and poetry.

name: Highwind Darkmane
description: The Forsworn and their mounts take on a darker aspect upon renouncing the path laid forth by the Archon. While tame enough to ride, the Highwind Darkmane has a fiercely independent streak.

name: Tarachnid Creeper
description: These tarachnids make their home in the darkest corners of Zereth Mortis, coming out only to hunt (or, sometimes, carry a rider around).

name: Patient Bufonid
description: Some bufonids will sit perfectly still for hours or days at a time if left to their own devices. Fortunately, they're also quite agreeable if a rider would like to move more often than that.

name: Black Nightsaber
description: Considered one of Azeroth's perfect predators, these agile beasts can sprint through dense forests without making a sound.

name: Swift Brown Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Bound Blizzard
description: A flurrious, fridgid friend, frost-flecked for frozen fun.

name: Turquoise Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Mottled Red Raptor
description: Bred from the fiercest stock anywhere and guaranteed not to bite (much).

name: Swift Albino Raptor
description: The Witherbark warrior Beastrider Kama once cut bloody swathes of terror across the Arathi Highlands astride such a monster.

name: Sunwarmed Furline
description: The presence of the giant felines heralds the beginning of the end for the birds of Azeroth.

name: Rekindled Dreamstag
description: Ashes of fallen leaves are fertile soil for dreamstags to arise from.

name: Great Gray Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.

name: Crimson Tidestallion
description: The blood-red coloration of these creatures is ideal for hiding in large coral formations.

name: Cosmic Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Ironside Warwolf
description: It has an armored spike on its tail. Scratch its belly at your own risk.

name: Broken Highland Mustang
description: One of the Arathi horses, taken and broken by the Horde conquerors of Stromgarde.

name: Darkwarren Hardshell
description: The Darkwarren Hardshell's chitin is sturdy enough to withstand mortar shells and dragon's fire. It will also conveniently consume anything lacking anima, if needed.

name: Thundering Cobalt Cloud Serpent
description: This is a descendant of the irascible Nalak. Lightning erupts from its scales and arcs over the saddle. Dare you sit?

name: Striped Frostsaber
description: This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.

name: Frightened Kodo
description: Nothing frightens a kodo like seeing a bear with antlers.

name: Squeakers, the Trickster
description: The locals in Halfhill swear that whenever a batch of grain is missing, a farmworking instrument is misplaced, or a bushel of berries can't be found, you can hear a mischievous squeaking, and are reminded to slow down and accept what life gives you.

name: Mammyth
description: In the Dream, sometimes the myth is more real than its basis.

name: Swift Timber Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Explorer's Dunetrekker
description: The surly dunetrekker can easily carry a set of explorers to the nearest ruins and back without the need to rest.

name: Sunreaver Hawkstrider
description: I demand speed, grace and discipline on the battlefield. This one will serve nicely. -Eressea Dawnsinger

name: White Mechanostrider Mod B
description: Forced to recall the model after numerous complaints of an "uncontrollable throttle", Gnomish engineers now refer to a proto-type blunder as a "model B".

name: Telix the Stormhorn
description: Once a simple beetle of the Forbidden Reach, Telix became infused with storm magic when Raszageth was unleashed. With its newly heightened senses, Telix roams the Dragon Isles alongside the Dragonscale Expedition--and you!

name: Swift Gloomhoof
description: The ballads of Ardenweald claim that the birth of gloomrunner heralds the passing of a particularly benevolent wild god. Seeing a gloomrunner is therefore a blessing and a curse.

name: Time-Lost Proto-Drake
description: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.

name: Seething Slug
description: Drawn forth from its abyss by the rage of the Zaqali.

name: Darkspear Raptor
description: This raptor breed was originally cultivated by the Drakkari, but has since been adopted by the Darkspear tribe in Northrend.

name: Magenta Cloud Serpent
description: More affectionate than their cousins, Magenta Cloud Serpents are known to form close bonds with their riders.

name: Swift Burgundy Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Maelie, the Wanderer
description: A curious and inquisitive doe, she doesn't mean to worry her master, she just gets distracted easily. Especially with all of the new things to see on Korthia.

name: Green Mechanostrider
description: "The terradynamic exo-plotters are conjoined by hydraulic imaging to the equilibrium enhancers..." -Binjy Featherwhistle

name: Obsidian Gravewing
description: In the darkened skies of Revendreth, you cannot see these creatures coming until it is too late.

name: War-Bred Tauralus
description: The soldiers of Maldraxxus protect the Shadowlands, and require a mount that is both capable and calm when faced with overwhelming odds.

name: Great Golden Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Southern Barrens.

name: Bloodgorged Hunter
description: If he wasn't so full, you wouldn't have caught him.

name: Waste Marauder
description: Larger than most of its kin, this vulture has shown sick and strong beasts alike why they need to fear the skies.

name: Ancient Salamanther
description: Due to their preference for dark caves and murky waters, sightings of this unique breed of salamanther are so rare that many researchers thought they had gone extinct.

name: Vengeance
description: Sylvanas lost a part of herself the day Arthas took her life, and the darkness within her grew to fill the void.

name: Glacial Tidestorm
description: Though she commands a variety of magical powers, Jaina has always been most proficient at summoning powerful elementals of water and ice.

name: Hand of Bahmethra
description: The most wicked and cruel of her kin, Bahmethra endured the full measure of the Banished One's punishments before her fall.

name: Spotted Frostsaber
description: This hearty mount's ferocious appetite earned it the nickname "Dragon Belly" in the night elf language.

name: Phalynx of Loyalty
description: Some within the Ascended keep a phalynx as a pet. While they may not be as furry as a larion, they are much less likely to eat your other pets.

name: Riding Kodo
description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

name: Swift Zulian Tiger
description: The last known Zulian tigers were kept by High Priest Thekal, deep within Zul'Gurub.  They are said to have been hunted into extinction.

name: Wandering Ancient
description: A staunch defender of the forests of Azeroth, the ancients are also known for their glorious canopies of leaves, which change color with the seasons.

name: Phalynx of Courage
description: A phalynx is considered both a worthy companion and a lithe opponent to test one's reflexes against.

name: Gooey Snailemental
description: Formed from the leftover elemental energies of the Primal Storms, this magical mollusk is faster than it appears.

name: Savage Green Battle Turtle
description: Turtle too slow to chase down your foes? Just add cannons. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

name: Battle Gargon Silessa
description: Silessa fought valiantly alongside her master in the great incursion by the Light, following the battle her master set her to guard over a vault room of great value.

name: Magmashell
description: Who's a good little new-forged snail made entirely of elemental lava? You are! Yes, you!

name: Stormpike Battle Charger
description: The Stormpike clan's mount trainers have a tradition of etching their names onto the left horn of every battle ram they raise.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Vicious War Turtle
description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

name: Vicious Warstalker
description: Trample the Alliance to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Horde!

name: Winding Slitherdrake
description: These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.

name: Colossal Soulshredder Mawrat
description: The incredible prowess you have demonstrated within the Jailer's Tower has instilled sufficient respect into this fearsome creature, enabling its use as a mount.

name: Frostwolf Howler
description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan.

name: Renewed Proto-Drake
description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

name: Temperamental Skyclaw
description: Slyverns are rarely comfortable acting as mounts. Only those willing to feed their gluttonous appetites and keep a careful eye on them should attempt to ride.

name: Bronze Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Crimson Slavermaw
description: Answers to a series of noises that cannot be made by non-demonic creatures but roughly translates to "Deathslobber."

name: Colossal Slaughterclaw
description: Only the most stalwart stable masters of Maldraxxus are able to break the will of the colossal slaughterclaws, giving all champions of the Undying Army a fearsome ally in the Shadowlands.

name: Mogu Hazeblazer
description: This ancient mogu artifact controls ambient fog to enable levitation.

name: Crimson Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Great Brown Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Northern Barrens.

name: Regal Corpsefly
description: Only the forces of Maldraxxus would call a corpsefly "regal."

name: Gravestone Battle Gargon
description: Representative of a new loyal batch of gargon, these battle ready beasts will take Renathal's most loyal compatriots into the final battles against the Jailer.

name: Bestowed Sandskimmer
description: A gift from Granpap Whiskers, these capricious skitterflies help the Timewalkers clean up present (and future) sand-related temporal calamities.

name: Jigglesworth Sr.
description: It's unclear how the saddle stays atop this formerly feline friend, but somehow the House of Plagues made it work. Science.

name: Plaguerot Tauralus
description: The tauralus is considered courageous, though scholars of Maldraxxus have long wondered if their lack of fear is simply due to the tiny size of their brains.

name: Scarlet Helicid
description: This helicid's unusual reddish tint is clearly intentional in its design, but the only other difference between these and other helicids is the unusual lack of any ooze.

name: Pestilent Necroray
description: When a necroray hatches, spores fly everywhere, making a huge mess.

name: Scrappy Worldsnail
description: For the Worldbreakers, a portable footstool. For you, a hardy mount.

name: Hailstorm Armoredon
description: Born in the middle of an ice storm, this armoredon prefers its meals partially frozen.

name: Black War Bear
description: Killing leaders of the Horde is its own reward, but this intimidating beast is an excellent memento.

name: Lightforged Ruinstrider
description: A loyal steed to the Lightforged Draenei.

name: Subterranean Magmammoth
description: Awakened from a long slumber, this beast has yet to see the light of day.

name: Dragon Isles Drake Model Test
description: NYI

name: Lizi, Thunderspine Tramper
description: Nothing will stop Lizi from her mission to eat all the world's fruit.

name: Smoky Charger
description: Among the oldest horse breeds in Kul Tiras, they even led many a charge in the original struggle with the drust.

name: Soultwisted Deathwalker
description: A howling vortex of tormented souls, ridden only by those who wish to demonstrate their impressive tolerance for pain and suffering.
