name: Amber Pterrordax
description: The Pterrordax could and would eat you in seconds. Are you sure sitting on its back is a good idea?

name: Highland Drake
description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

name: Dreamlight Runestag
description: Runestags are granted to those who have pledged their service to the Winter Queen and the Court of Night.

name: Shellack
description: Fed by victory and hardened by glory, this snail is nothing less than a tribute to mastery.

name: Desire's Battle Gargon
description: The Countess maintains a small stable of elegantly adorned gargon mounts for her sole use. Many a rival has been taken in by the finery to their peril as she personally oversees their deadly training.

name: Vicious War Spider
description: When being a courageous member of the Alliance doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

name: Loyal Gorger
description: Crawling forth from the cracks between the realms, the devourers have a voracious appetite for anima. Little is known of their origins, but all denizens of the Shadowlands see their recent boldness as a sign of the end times.

name: Swift Spectral Drake
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Obsidian Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

name: Phalynx of Purity
description: Little is known about the origination of phalynx technology, the machinations of which are taught more akin to religion than engineering.

name: Violet Proto-Drake
description: I cannot help but wonder if things would have turned out different if the titans had elevated even one more dragonflight. -Alexstrasza

name: Heartbond Lupine
description: From the moment of its creation, this packless lupine has held nothing more than deepest affection and loyalty towards you.

name: Mekgineer's Chopper
description: Sporting superb engineering craftsmanship, this chopper is one of the few personal vehicles on Azeroth built for two.

name: Soulbound Gloomcharger
description: Ve'nari has many methods of sneaking around the Maw and disrupting the Jailer's plans, including binding his own minions.

name: Soaring Spelltome
description: In the forgotten depths of the Dalaran library, this oversized tome was found flapping madly around the room. Open the pages of this arcane-infused book and hitch a ride to magical adventure.

name: Green Proto-Drake
description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

name: Mechagon Mechanostrider
description: The best mount, logically, serves multiple purposes -- sometimes you need to get places AND reach something high up once you get there.

name: Raging Magmammoth
description: Most lava flows. This lava charges.

name: Colossal Wraithbound Mawrat
description: Infused by the energies of tormented souls, these creatures have adopted ghostlike abilities that make them quite elusive.

name: Colossal Plaguespew Mawrat
description: These rodents became Iska's infamous sentries, scouting and carrying her plague across the Maw. Their presence is only followed by ruin.

name: Elusive Emerald Hawkstrider
description: Unseen for many years, this brightly hued hawkstrider emerged from hiding to help defend the Ghostlands from the Scourge. Its prowess shines as brilliantly as its feathers.

name: Coral-Stalker Waveray
description: This species of ray seems to have evolved to stalk its prey amidst the brightly colored corals of the seas.

name: Amalgam of Rage
description: The fearsome beast ridden by Astaroth himself is now yours to command.

name: Black War Bear
description: This formidable mount is bought with the blood of Alliance leaders, but you would have killed them for free.

name: Autumnal Wilderling
description: The wilderlings are benevolent, magical creatures of Ardenweald, and are drawn to souls that are strong and pure.

name: Azureshell Krolusk
description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

name: Ardenweald Wilderling
description: As anima flows to the distant wealds of Ardenweald once more, the wilderlings awaken and cautiously emerge from their canopy burrows.

name: Stormhide Salamanther
description: Sometimes when storm energies infuse a creature, it simply... becomes larger and more placid. Few salamanthers are willing to be ridden, but these children of the storm are a notable exception.

name: Winter Wilderling
description: Wilderlings serve as support units in battle, preserving their allies and rendering enemy magics useless.

name: Yellow Scouting Ottuk
description: The yellow scouting ottuk love to hide and they blend in well to their surroundings. When not 'playing' hide and seek with their riders, they are perfect companions when scouting enemy encampments.

name: Battle-Bound Warhound
description: Warhounds find comfort in conflict, and the Contest of Conquest is the perfect place to find these beasts honing their abilities.

name: Albino Drake
description: Even the Draconic Native Association tests proved inconclusive in determining if the albino drake is related to a known dragonflight. -Breanni

name: Blue Proto-Drake
description: The Storm Peaks! There we will find the beast strong enough to bear me into battle. -Skadi the Ruthless

name: Cerulean Marsh Hopper
description: Gottum's expansion into export markets was inevitable with news of the Trading Post reaching even into the depths of the Frogmarsh.

name: Vicious Sabertooth
description: The elite Alliance forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Darnassian as "here kitty kitty".

name: Eternal Phalynx of Humility
description: When an armored phalynx is forged, stewards clap their hammers together in reverence of the skill required in its creation.

name: Armored Brown Bear
description: This ursine mount's swiftness is enhanced by its heavy armor, imbued with magic from Kirin Tor magi.

name: Nether Drake
description: The moods of these tempestuous mounts are known to shift as unpredictably and as violently as their physical forms.

name: Ascended Skymane
description: Only those that have proven themselves against the combined might of the Ascended will be able to ride this mount.

name: Gnomeregan Mechanostrider
description: When you absolutely, positively have to be there right now. -Rillie Spindlenut

name: Brown War Ottuk
description: The tuskarr of Iskaara are loathe to war against anyone, but many tuskarr and their allies have nonetheless taken up the spear with a war ottuk beside them.

name: Armored Snowy Gryphon
description: The nice thing is that when they attack, blood almost never stains their feathers. -Mei Francis

name: Colossal Ebonclaw Mawrat
description: This vicious and cunning creature has grown to its astonishing size by not only feasting upon the weakened souls in the Jailer's Tower, but also vulnerable Mawsworn.

name: Zovaal's Soul Eater
description: "Was I a good boy?" the soul asked Zovaal. "No. I'm told you were the worst."

name: Black Proto-Drake
description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed exceptional resilience and fortitude facing the dangers in Northrend.

name: Green Kodo
description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Desolace.

name: Battle-Hardened Aquilon
description: The aquilon can be a valuable ally in combat, with capabilities exceeding those of the phalynx.

name: Vicious War Spider
description: When being a bellowing member of the Horde doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

name: Blisterback Bloodtusk
description: The House of the Chosen train their mounts in all manner of difficult circumstances, so that no matter the battle, they will never falter.

name: Wastewander Skyterror
description: Doubting a Wastewander Skyterror's capabilities is a quick way to find yourself missing a limb.

name: Purple Hawkstrider
description: Some of our brethren prefer horses, but the hawkstrider will always be the true symbol of Silvermoon. -Winaestra

name: Bronze Helicid
description: Some helicids of Zereth Mortis have strangely metallic shells. The ones who do are generally a bronze color, indistinct from the metal any novice miner could work, save that this creature's construction far surpasses the skill of any novice.

name: Swift Green Wind Rider
description: I still don't get why they fly faster when you put armor on them. -Drakma

name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
description: A common sight on trade routes all across Azeroth, this calm, stalwart mount is the favorite of merchants traveling to exotic and distant markets.

name: Bestowed Trawling Mammoth
description: A gift from Scout Tomul, so that the feasts of Iskaara will always have enough fish to feed those in need.

name: Darnassian Nightsaber
description: When a night elf's mount perishes, it is custom for the rider to keep one of the saber's great fangs as a token of remembrance.

name: Carcinized Zerethsteed
description: The few of these mysterious creatures that remain appear to be impossibly old, almost timeless. Perhaps they were created by the First Ones, because no schematic to synthesize these has yet been discovered.

name: Grand Black War Mammoth
description: Once used by giants to carry heavily armored warriors, these grand war mammoths can easily bear more than one rider of less-than-giant stature.

name: Red Dragonhawk
description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

name: Marrowfang
description: Marrowfang, Bonefang's progeny, was respected by Amarth the Harvester for her insatiable appetite, even if it disrupted any experiments that the sadistic commander wanted to run.

name: Heartlight Vombata
description: The Enlightened revere all creations of the First Ones, yet for many, the vombata of Zereth Mortis are the most beloved. These creatures are equal parts trusted beast of burden and beloved companion.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Ren's Stalwart Hound
description: Houndlord Ren used his strongest quilen to carry him across Pandaria to subjugate the Vale for the Mogu empire.

name: Mossy Mammoth
description: Preserved for thousands of years in stone, bronze magic has nearly aged this mammoth back into a fossil.

name: Unchained Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Armored Brown Bear
description: Your cries of "For the Horde!" will be much more menacing from atop a heavily armored bear that's barreling down on Alliance at top speed.

name: Plagued Proto-Drake
description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed significant courage and persistence facing the dangers in Northrend.

name: Eternal Phalynx of Purity
description: The armored phalynx is a favorite companion of the mightiest warriors of the Ascended as it is both fearless and vicious in battle.

name: Arboreal Gulper
description: The wood and foliage growing atop this toad is a natural part of its body, helping it siphon anima from the air to nourish itself.

name: Blue Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

name: Great Brewfest Kodo
description: Coren Direbrew won this prize after drinking a Tauren druid under the table - and the druid was in bear form. It was one of Direbrew's proudest moments.

name: Alabaster Stormtalon
description: Chiseled by the stonemasons of Stormwind, this stone gryphon symbolizes the unbending courage of the Alliance.

name: Big Blizzard Bear
description: Whenever you ride this mount, you feel the urge to shout, "Cry havoc and let slip the murlocs of war!"

name: Royal Snapdragon
description: Captured at a young age and raised to serve naga hunters, snapdragons are loyal and fierce companions.

name: Lord of the Corpseflies
description: To be the Lord of the Corpseflies, you've got to lay a LOT of eggs.

name: Magnificent Flying Carpet
description: Standard features include a sturdy imbued frostweave frame and real iceweb spider silk threading.  Spare head pillow sold separately.

name: Bronze Drake
description: Lost time is never found again. Oh, never mind I found it. -Chronormu

name: Flying Carpet
description: Hop aboard this flying carpet to see the shining, shimmering, and splendid world of Azeroth, wonder by wonder.

name: Silent Glider
description: Gasses naturally stored within the creature allowed it to survive within the depths, those same gasses also allow them to effortlessly float through the air.

name: Lurid Bloodtusk
description: Only bloodtusks that survive the Contest of Conquest are deemed worthy enough to become a mount of the Undying Army.

name: White Skeletal Warhorse
description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

name: Grand Ice Mammoth
description: Due to high winds and avalanches, the Sons of Hodir recommend bringing at least two companions if venturing into the dangerous Storm Peaks.

name: Dauntless Duskrunner
description: The Path of Ascension is a challenging trial, and those that display all of the facets the Kyrian hold dear will be duly rewarded.

name: Hulking Deathroc
description: Deathrocs are stitched monstrosities from the discarded viscera, bone, and organs that were not required to construct soldiers for the House of Constructs.

name: Junkheap Drifter
description: When you really want to be noticed... and don't mind strapping yourself to a giant, barely-held-together wheel.

name: Gruesome Flayedwing
description: The flayedwings of Maldraxxus are prized for their ability to soar effortlessly through the skies of the Shadowlands, allowing their rider a surprise opportunity to strike at their foes or support their allies.

name: Tan War Talbuk
description: Despite their docile nature, talbuks have been known to gore seasoned warriors to death when threatened.

name: Raptora Swooper
description: The raptora swooper is one of the most vicious iterations of its kind, perfectly suited for its ecological niche. Needing no further adjustments, the ones synthesized today are identical to those created in the past.

name: Jade, Bright Foreseer
description: The presence of this majestic Pandaren rabbit spirit brings joy and happiness and is heralded as a wonderful omen. Legend says that in its eyes, you can glimpse the greatest happiness of your life, even if it is yet to come.

name: Otto
description: Relax. The future will unfold as it was meant to, one way or an otter.

name: Swift Gray Wolf
description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

name: Springfur Alpaca
description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

name: Sapphire Skyblazer
description: These brilliant blue birds burn brighter (and hotter) than their orange cousins, though the origin of both remains a mystery.

name: Azure Drake
description: Always speak politely to an enraged dragon.

name: Tuskarr Shoreglider
description: The Tuskarr learned long ago that some of the bones of the sea creatures they hunted were light and buoyant, making for effective glider materials.

name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

name: Turbostrider
description: The mirror's not so you can look back, but so your foes can see something besides your tailpipes. -Rillie Spindlenut

name: Vicious War Scorpion
description: Has very few non-pointy ends.

name: Sandstone Drake
description: Sandstone Drakes were studied in great detail long ago by the famed alchemist Walleye Sprysprocket. It has even been said that Walleye developed potions to mimic the drakes' physiology.

name: Grand Black War Mammoth
description: Rarely, a war mammoth is born stronger and more tractable than its peers. These mammoths are dubbed "grand" and carry more than one rider to the front lines.

name: Wild Hunt Legsplitter
description: Integrated into the depleted forces of the Wild Hunt, the fawn riders quickly found that the gorm's powerful mandibles were perfect for cutting down close enemy ranks.

name: Cartel Master's Gearglider
description: Only the richest cartel leaders are able to afford the metals required to craft the Cartel Master's Gearglider.

name: Zereth Overseer
description: Enigmatic and aloof, this construct of the First Ones flies on a graceful stream of perfect geometric understanding.

name: Golden King
description: Don't let the saddle fool you, he's wild, not a tame lion.

name: Otterworldly Ottuk Carrier
description: Some ottuks get into the spirit of carrying people around more than others.

name: Eternal Gladiator's Soul Eater
description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

name: Silver Covenant Hippogryph
description: Silver Covenant Hippogryphs are fiercely loyal, both to their riding partners, and to the Alliance.

name: Vicious War Basilisk
description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

name: Midnight
description: Still one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.

name: Skullripper
description: She's a clever girl.

name: Wen Lo, the River's Edge
description: The rivers of Pandaria, like Wen Lo, are unpredictable in nature. They may remain calm, bringing water to the crops, or flood, bringing ruin. Wen Lo reminds us that we must adapt to the challenges of life.

name: Windborne Velocidrake
description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

name: Mag'har Direwolf
description: Native to Draenor, these wolves are preferred by the Mag'har for their ferocity, loyalty, and for something to snuggle on those cool winter nights.

name: Snapback Scuttler
description: Giant crabs are native to Nazjatar and a favored food of the naga. This one must have been well-kept to grow this large.

name: Green Qiraji Battle Tank
description: This (relatively) domesticated silithid is at home only in the desert sands of Ahn'Qiraj.

name: Swift Spectral Pterrordax
description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

name: Ice Mammoth
description: Many ice giants claim that they have trained their favored white mammoths to trigger avalanches with their trumpeting calls.

name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
description: Ancient manuscripts depict merchants traveling across the frozen tundra with these colossal beasts, leading scholars to believe they are the first domesticated mounts.

name: Prestigious Midnight Courser
description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

name: Explorer's Stonehide Packbeast
description: A true explorer never stays in one place for long. Having a reliable packbeast with a strong back and sturdy legs is essential for travel.

name: Prototype Leaper
description: An ancient schematic allows for the instantiation of this early, but functional, bufonid design.

name: Renewed Magmammoth
description: Reforged after destruction at the hands of the Druids of the Flame, this magmammoth is ready to stomp any foes in its path.

name: Plainswalker Bearer
description: The mammoths of the Ohn'ahran Plains are unaccustomed to carrying people, as their centaur neighbors do not typically ride mounts. They can learn to bear riders, however. Some even do so enthusiastically.

name: Ironbound Proto-Drake
description: His skin more hard than brass was found, that sword nor spear could pierce nor wound.

name: Vibrant Mana Ray
description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

name: Sanctum Gloomcharger
description: Only the Jailer's most powerful lieutenants are gifted these steeds to stalk the halls of the Tower.

name: Magic Rooster
description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

name: Green Marsh Hopper
description: Gottum collects spawns of Krag'wa from all around the Frogmarsh, but only the most bulbous are used as mounts.

name: Black War Steed
description: Trained to withstand brutal hand-to-hand combat in the fiercest battlefields.

name: Highlord's Golden Charger
description: The fanciest of all of the horses.

name: Sky Surfer
description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the skies.

name: Crimson Gladiator's Drake
description: Forged in the fires of conquest, and armored to the teeth.

name: Ivory Trader's Ottuk
description: No adult knows why some ottuks are white, but any tuskarr child can tell you: it's because they eat too much snow.

name: Lil' Donkey
description: Likely stolen from Newstead in the Arathi Highlands, this stalwart little donkey was destined to be eaten by kobolds.

name: Vicious War Gorm
description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

name: Vicious War Turtle
description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

name: Phalynx of Humility
description: The phalynx does not fetch, though it is not known why this is.

name: Rampaging Mauler
description: One would think controlling a rampaging mount would be difficult, but if you can learn to control the direction of the rampage it can be quite useful.

name: Sarge's Tale
description: Hold on a sec, Sarge isn't that large, someone must have spun a tall tale in the Hearthstone Tavern...

name: Bestowed Ottuk Vanguard
description: A gift from Brena, the Iskaara sent their most loyal (and adorable) companions to watch over Kalecgos and his reuinited family in Valdrakken

name: Vicious Warstalker
description: Trample the Horde to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Alliance!

name: Armored Siege Kodo
description: Only the strongest and most fearless of kodos can be trained to become living siege weapons. Even the highest walls won't keep them out for long.

name: Yellow Marsh Hopper
description: No one makes giant, slimy spawns like Krag'wa the Huge.

name: Armored Blue Wind Rider
description: They are not native to Northrend, but they have adapted extremely well to the cold. -Mei Francis

name: Orgrimmar Wolf
description: For a brief time, many orcs would declare themselves "hungry like an Orgrimmar wolf." Some blood elves still use the phrase ironically.

name: Callow Flayedwing
description: Flayedwings are a necessary force in the cycle of life for the Shadowlands, acting as both prey and predator for the harsh environment of Maldraxxus.

name: Sapphire Vorquin
description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.
